column1:
## History of presenting illness
29 years old man who came in on the 2024-01-29 with a suspected influenza. Found outside the special care facility by the patients family coming to visit.

## Past medical history
Asthma, smoker, schizophrenia.

## Treatment course
Patient complains of headache and pain in left hip. Disoriented, hallucinating. Hard to do physical examination. Temp 36,7. Sat 95%. CRP 3. PCR positive for Influenza A. CT brain, cervical spine and pelvis without remarks. Patient feels better, but believes he is at a hotel. Doesn’t understand why he needs to stay in bed, comments that this is an odd practice at a hotel. However patient remains calm and cooperative. Personell say they found many pills behind the bed, most likely the patients antipsycotics for the last days. Receives a urinary catheter because of residual urine 533 ml. Recieves Movicol for contstipation. After five days of Cefotaxim switch to per oral doxycycline until 2024-02-04 after contact with infectious disease consultant. Patient uses walker to mobilise and has fallen multiple times lately. Transported to the psyciatric care department according to recommendationts of psyciatrist.

## Medications
Anoro Ellipta (Umeclidinium, Vilanterol)	55/22 Î¼g/Î¼g 1+0+0
Finasterid (Finasteride) 5 Mg	1+0+0
Olanzapin (Olanzapine) 10 Mg 1+0+0
Tamiflu (Oseltamivir) 75 Mg 1+0+1
Alvedon (Paracetamol) 500 Mg 2+2+2
Doxycyklin (Doxycycline)100 Mg 1+0+0 until 2024-02-04

## Plan after discharge
Referral to psycatric outpatient unit for continuation and monitoring of care.

## Procedures
  None

## Secondary diagnosis
Asthma
Schizophrenia

## Main diagnosis 
Unspecified exacerbation of schizophrenia

## Differential diagnosis
Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease with (acute) exacerbation
